flashcards.description: HTML (Hypertext Markup Language) is the standard markup language for creating web pages. It provides the structure and content of a webpage through elements like headings, paragraphs, and links.
CSS (Cascading Style Sheets) is used for styling web pages. It allows you to control the layout, colors, and typography of HTML elements, enhancing the visual presentation of a website.
JavaScript is a versatile programming language used for web development. It enables interactive and dynamic behavior on web pages, allowing for actions like form validation and responsive design.
Semantic HTML elements are those that convey the meaning and structure of the content to both browsers and developers. They include elements like <header>, <nav>, <section>, and <footer>.
CSS Flexbox is a layout model that simplifies the alignment and distribution of items in a container. It's especially useful for creating flexible and responsive page layouts.
JavaScript frameworks like React, Angular, and Vue provide pre-built structures and libraries for building complex web applications, making development more efficient.
Responsive web design is an approach that makes web pages render well on a variety of devices and window or screen sizes. It uses CSS media queries to adjust layouts and content.
CSS Grid Layout is a two-dimensional grid system that allows precise control of the layout of web pages. It's great for creating complex, grid-based designs.
The DOM represents the structure of a web page as a tree of objects that can be manipulated with JavaScript. It allows for dynamic updates and interactions on a webpage.
Web accessibility ensures that websites and web applications are usable by people with disabilities. It involves techniques like using ARIA roles and providing alternative text for images.
